aiclient Package¶

MyAI Module¶

MyAI Class¶

class aiclient.MyAI.MyAI[source]¶

Bases: aiclient.AIDefault.AIDefault

Class for you to add your intelligence to the AI, you can use the super() methods to access the default AI or create your own using the code in AiDefault

AIDefault Module¶

AIDefault Class¶

class aiclient.AIDefault.AIDefault[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Represents the AI that need to be implemented

aiStatus = <AIStatus.INIT: 0>¶

The current status of the AI example (Can be deleted)

initState()[source]¶

Function call for the init state of the AI example (Can be deleted)

lowerLeft()[source]¶

Function call for the lowerLeft state of the AI example (Can be deleted)

lowerRight()[source]¶

Function call for the lowerRight state of the AI example (Can be deleted)

tick()[source]¶

Function call every 30 ms, this is the starting point for the AI (Cannot be deleted)

upperLeft()[source]¶

Function call for the upperLeft state of the AI example (Can be deleted)

upperRight()[source]¶

Function call for the upperRight state of the AI example (Can be deleted)

world = <world.World.World object at 0x4160538c>¶
The world singleton needed to get the info on the current state of the world
(see World)
